page.title: 09FISHING IN SKERRIES
page.content: Fishing in Skerries like a lot of other isles in Shetland. I goes back to the age of the{yoal}and{sixern}and has developed over the years. Even today the community depends on the sea and what it gives. The biggest in the Skerries fleet is 72 foot long{COMET LK253.}The next is 56 foot long{HORIZON LK250,}both were built in Norway. Lastly come{JASPER {LK57}and{BOY JAN LK244}both bought second hand. The Boy Jan is used for service to the{salmon farm}which at the moment is growing 45,000 fish. The fish landed are mostly white fish, but rough fish are also caught. Herring have not been fished here in many years. The lobster has not been fished here commercially for some time but people do fish them in small boats in the Autumn. Fishing is a popular Summer pastime using small boats.
